ratings.comment: Professor Roys is very clear with his expectations and is a good teacher. Would take a course with him again!

Professor Roys was awesome, by far my favorite professor so far at Madison. He is very smart and teaches the material in a way that is very easy to understand. His tests are very fair and if you study they should be easy.  This was one class where I felt sad once it ended. I highly recommended this professor.

Roys was tough to follow at first but once you get over the accent he's really good. He was super helpful in office hours. For 302, he expects a solid calc base, so brush up on that before starting the class. Don't follow all his steps when he's showing you formulas- you'll just confuse yourself. Just make sure you get the final formula.

Good lecturer despite the French accent.  Lectures are very informative and tests are very fair.  Not a ton of homework but it does help for exams.  TA wasn't great but I would highly recommend Roys for 302.

Best professor for 302. Exams are extremely predictable, always taken from the problem sets or the in-class examples. Takes student feedback halfway through the semester and tweaks the class based on the responses.
Great Professor. Slides were very helpful. Doing the problem and questions for review was really good practice for the exams.

He is honestly a so-so professor but the best for 302. He teaches you the background of an issue and then connects it to current events which can be very interesting if you care about the economy around you. Just do the problems sets, earlier exams and in class exercises and you should know the material. Study guide is useless but book was helpful
Funny guy, good teacher. Examples on the board are extremely helpful. Exams test a small portion of a relatively large amount of material.

Roys is a great professor. takes a little while to get over his french accent, but really cares about his students. gives examples on the board exactly like the ones on the homework/exams. discussion also helped out alot. exams are usually 3-5 essay or graphing questions, which makes studying fairly easy. absolutley recommend him.
